page.title: 11THE WHATTON EXCHANGE
page.content: The British Telecom system that we have is efficient enough for our village because there are no industries. Most of the connecting is done by hand but there is not an awful lot of connecting to do. The system is constantly being made better, as British Telecom develop more technically advanced equipment. Whatton Exchange is connected with two in Nottingham because if one becomes busy they can use the other exchange. 75% of the population in this village have a telephone in their home. It is important that we have an exchange in Whatton, but with the advances made in electronics it may soon become obsolete. It is a most important job, working at British Telecom. They take special notice of the 999 calls so they can connect straight away.
